00027 ProgParameter::ProgParameter()
00028 {
00029     needed() = true;
00030     hidden() = false;
00031 }
00032 ProgParameter::ProgParameter( const ProgParameter &ref ): PropertyValue( static_cast<const PropertyValue &>( ref ) ), m_hidden( false ) {}
00033 
00034 bool ProgParameter::isHidden() const
00035 {
00036     return m_hidden;
00037 }

00039 {
00040     return m_hidden;

00042 
00043 bool ProgParameter::parse( const Value<std::string> &props )
00044 {
00045     _internal::ValueBase &me = **this;
00046     bool ret = false;
00047 
00048     if ( ( ( std::string )props ).empty() ) {
00049         if ( me.is<bool>() ) {
00050             me.castTo<bool>() = true;
00051             ret = true;
00052         }
00053     } else {
00054         ret = _internal::ValueBase::convert( props, me );
00055     }
00056 
00057     LOG_IF( ret, Debug, info ) << "Parsed " << MSubject( props.toString() ) << " as " << me.toString( true );
00058 
00059     if( ret )m_set = true;
00060 
00061     return ret;
00062 }
00063 bool ProgParameter::parse_list( const isis::util::Value< slist >& props_list )
00064 {
00065     _internal::ValueBase &me = **this;
00066     bool ret = false;
00067     const util::slist &theList = props_list.castTo<util::slist>();
00068 
00069     if ( theList.empty() ) {
00070         //there is nothing like a bool-list (yet)
00071     } else {
00072         ret = _internal::ValueBase::convert( props_list, me );
00073     }
00074 
00075     LOG_IF( ret, Debug, info )
00076             << "Parsed parameter list " << MSubject( util::listToString( theList.begin(), theList.end(), " ", "", "" ) ) << " as " << me.toString( true );
00077 
00078     if( ret )m_set = true;
00079 
00080     return ret;
00081 }

00098 ParameterMap::ParameterMap(): parsed( false ) {}
00099 
00100 bool ParameterMap::parse( int argc, char **argv )
00101 {
00102     parsed = true;
00103     std::string pName;
00104 
00105     for ( int i = 1; i < argc; ) { // scan through the command line, to find next parameter
00106         if ( argv[i][0] == '-' ) { //seems like we found a new parameter here
00107             pName = argv[i];
00108             pName.erase( 0, pName.find_first_not_of( '-' ) );
00109         } else {
00110             LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Ignoring unexpected non-parameter " << MSubject( argv[i] );
00111         }
00112 
00113         i++;
00114 
00115         if( !pName.empty() ) { // if we got a parameter before
00116             const int start = i;
00117 
00118             while( i < argc && argv[i][0] != '-' ) { //collect its properties, while there are some ..
00119                 i++;
00120             }
00121 
00122             std::list<std::string> matchingStrings;
00123             BOOST_FOREACH( ParameterMap::const_reference parameterRef, *this ) {
00124                 if( parameterRef.first.find( pName ) == 0 ) {
00125                     matchingStrings.push_back( parameterRef.first );
00126                 }
00127             }
00128 
00129             if( matchingStrings.size() > 1 ) {
00130                 std::stringstream matchingStringStream;
00131                 BOOST_FOREACH( std::list<std::string>::const_reference stringRef, matchingStrings ) {
00132                     matchingStringStream << stringRef << " ";
00133                 }
00134                 LOG( Runtime, warning )
00135                         << "The parameter \"" << pName << "\" is ambiguous. The parameters \""
00136                         << matchingStringStream.str().erase( matchingStringStream.str().size() - 1, 1 )
00137                         << "\" are possible. Ignoring this parameter!";
00138             } else if ( !matchingStrings.size() ) {
00139                 LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Ignoring unknown parameter " << MSubject( std::string( "-" ) + pName + " " + listToString( argv + start, argv + i, " ", "", "" ) );
00140             } else {
00141                 if( at( matchingStrings.front() )->is<util::slist>() &&
00142                     at( matchingStrings.front() ).parse_list( util::slist( argv + start, argv + i ) )
00143                   ) { //dont do tokenizing if the target is an slist (is already done by the shell)
00144                     at( matchingStrings.front() ).needed() = false; //remove needed flag, because the value is set (aka "not needed anymore")
00145                 } else if ( at( matchingStrings.front() ).parse( listToString( argv + start, argv + i, ",", "", "" ) ) ) { // parse the collected properties
00146                     at( matchingStrings.front() ).needed() = false; //remove needed flag, because the value is set (aka "not needed anymore")
00147                 } else {
00148                     LOG( Runtime, error )
00149                             << "Failed to parse the parameter " << MSubject( std::string( "-" ) + matchingStrings.front() ) << ": "
00150                             << ( start == i ? "nothing" : listToString( argv + start, argv + i, " ", "\"", "\"" ) )
00151                             << " was given, but a " << at( matchingStrings.front() )->getTypeName() << " was expected.";
00152                     parsed = false;
00153                 }
00154 
00155             }
00156         }
00157     }
00158 
00159     return parsed ;
00160 }
00161 bool ParameterMap::isComplete()const
00162 {
00163     LOG_IF( ! parsed, Debug, error ) << "You did not run parse() yet. This is very likely an error";
00164     return std::find_if( begin(), end(), neededP() ) == end();
00165 }
00166 
00167 ProgParameter::operator boost::scoped_ptr<_internal::ValueBase>::unspecified_bool_type()const
00168 {
00169     boost::scoped_ptr<_internal::ValueBase> dummy;
00170 
00171     if( ( *this )->castTo<bool>() )dummy.reset( new Value<int16_t> );
00172 
00173     return  dummy;
00174 }
00175 
00176 }
